client_profile: A couple looking to buy a studio apartment in Brussels, budget 490,000–895,000 EUR. Priorities include cafes & brunch, a residential and quiet environment, and central access.
must_have: Apartment size suitable for a couple
Access to public transport within 15 min
Proximity to cafes and brunch spots
nice_to_have: Proximity to parks or green spaces
red_flags: High property taxes in certain areas
High maintenance fees in some buildings
Potential noise from nearby bars and cafes
contradictions: Quiet living yet central access can be challenging
Desire for modern amenities may increase budget
Residential preference may limit cafe proximity
Balcony space may be scarce in apartments

top_districts.name: Ixelles
why: Features popular cafes like La Buvette and parks such as Flagey Square for relaxation.
Excellent public transport connections make commuting easy to central Brussels.
watch_out: Property prices can fluctuate based on market trends, impacting your budget.

top_districts.name: Saint-Gilles
why: Charming neighborhood known for its vibrant arts scene and numerous brunch spots.
Close to public transport providing quick access to the city center.
watch_out: Certain areas might become noisy during weekends due to nightlife activities.

top_districts.name: Etterbeek
why: Family-friendly district with parks like Parc du Cinquantenaire for outdoor activities.
Convenient access to metro stations streamlining your daily commute.
watch_out: Potential competition for housing may drive up prices in sought-after spots.
